text: Approval for the karl storz autofluorescence system.  The karl storz autofluorescence system is indicated for use in white light and autofluorescence bronchoscopy to identify and locate abnormal bronchial tissue for biopsy and histological evaluation.  It is indicated in patients who:  1) are suspected of having bronchogenic carcinoma and are scheduled for a bronchoscopy as part of a standard diagnostic staging or work-up  2) have been previously diagnosed with lung cancer and who are at high risk for recurrence  3) have abnormal sputum cytology  4) have abnormal chest x-ray, ct scan or similar technology.
